title: Jambalaya
summary: The recipe Jambalaya could satisfy your Creole craving in about 45 minutes. For $2.25 per serving, you get a main course that serves 5. One portion of this dish contains around 23g of protein, 19g of fat, and a total of 603 calories. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free diet. If you have rice, a lot of garlic, celery, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the white rice you could follow this main course with the Baked Rice Pudding as a dessert. 37 people have made this recipe and would make it again. With a spoonacular score of 65%, this dish is pretty good. Try One-Pot Jambalaya, Veg Jambalaya, and Jambalaya for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Albarino, ros√© Wine, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Cajun. These low-tannin, lower alcohol wines will complement the heat in spicy cajun dishes, instead of making your mouth burn more. One wine you could try is Doelas Rias Baixas Albarino. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Doelas Rias Baixas Albarino
productMatches.description: Crisp, clean and fresh! Aromatic fruit underpinned by a well balanced acidity. The palate offers notes of citrus and stone fruit, herbs and a pleasant mineral touch on the finish. Complex, refreshing and built for food.
